Created an attachment (id=20416)
Code fix for org.eclipse.osgi project

Changed FileManager.move() method to return false if the target file already
exists.  On Linux, File.renameTo() will replace an existing target file where
Win32 will fail returning false.

Created an attachment (id=20418)
code patch for org.eclipse.osgi.tests project

Rework test case code to better report failures.  Also, limit multiple file
manager test to win32 only.

re comment #2, are the multiple file manager tests not applicable to non-win32
platforms?

The multiple file manager test was written to open 2 file managers on the same
base directory and ensure that closing the managers cleaned up only when all
managers are closed. This test relied on a file lock to fail if the lock was
already held by the same process.  This is true on win32, but not on linux. To
test this correctly on linux would require launching another eclipse session to
test the locks.
The fix has been released in HEAD.  Thanks Phil.
